column6: and brother of the British writer and academic [[C.S. Lewis]]. Warren Lewis was a supply officer in the British army during and after [[World War I]]. After retiring in 1932 to live with his brother in Oxford
column7: he was one of the founding members of the [[Inklings]]. He wrote on French history
column8: and served as his brother's secretary for the later years of C.S. Lewis's life.

column1: *[[1982]]: ''[[Brothers and Friends|Brothers and Friends: The Diaries of Major Warren Hamilton Lewis]]'' (edited by [[Clyde S. Kilby]] and Marjorie Lamp Mead)
